alert.note: Alert for Wexford (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued March 31 at 9:16PM EDT until April 02 at 8:00AM EDT by NWS Gaylord
info.description: ...The Flood Watch continues for the following rivers in Michigan... Rifle River near Sterling affecting Arenac County. Manistee River near Sherman affecting Wexford County. .Heavy rain may fall on a deep primed snowpack leading to the melt increasing. Flows in rivers may increase quickly and reach critical levels. For the Rifle River...including Sterling...flooding is possible. For the Manistee River...including Sherman...flooding is possible. ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY EVENING TO SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Manistee River near Sherman. * WHEN...From Saturday evening to Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Flooding begins around the Wilderness Canoe livery along left bank of river just downstream of M-37 bridge. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:15 AM EDT Friday the stage was 12.9 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (8 pm EDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sat Sun Mon Manistee River Sherman 15.0 12.9 Fri 10 am ED 15.0 14.8 14.8 &&
info.instruction: Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and be prepared for possible flood warnings. If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Saturday afternoon at 1200 PM EDT.
